title: The Midnight Library
author: Matt Haig
officialSummary: Between life and death there is a library, and within that library, the shelves go on forever. Every book provides a chance to try another life you could have lived.
myReview: Absolutely mesmerizing! A philosophical journey through the infinite possibilities of life. Made me reflect on my own choices and appreciate the present.

title: Educated
author: Tara Westover
officialSummary: A memoir about a young girl who, kept out of school, leaves her survivalist family and goes on to earn a PhD from Cambridge University.
myReview: Powerful and inspiring story of resilience and the transformative power of education. Couldn't put it down!

title: Project Hail Mary
author: Andy Weir
officialSummary: A lone astronaut must save the earth from disaster in this incredible new science-based thriller from the author of The Martian.
myReview: Andy Weir does it again! Witty, scientifically fascinating, and emotionally engaging. The friendship aspect caught me off guard in the best way.

title: Atomic Habits
author: James Clear
officialSummary: An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones. Tiny Changes, Remarkable Results.

title: The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo
author: Taylor Jenkins Reid
officialSummary: Aging Hollywood icon Evelyn Hugo finally chooses to tell her story to unknown magazine reporter Monique Grant.

title: Thinking, Fast and Slow
author: Daniel Kahneman
officialSummary: A groundbreaking tour of the mind explaining the two systems that drive the way we think and make choices.
